content:
TITLE: Adding Documents with Vector Embeddings (JSON) DESCRIPTION: Example of adding documents with vector embeddings for AI-powered search. It shows how to include _vectors field with embeddings and regenerate options for different embedders. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/documents.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` [ { "id": 452, "title": "Female Trouble", "overview": "Delinquent high school student Dawn Davenport runs away from home and embarks upon a life of crime.", "_vectors": { "default": { "embeddings": [0.1, 0.2, 0.3], "regenerate": false }, "ollama": { "embeddings": [0.4, 0.12, 0.6], "regenerate": true } } } ] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Mistral Embedder Settings in Meilisearch JSON DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet demonstrates the configuration for setting up Mistral embeddings in Meilisearch. It includes the API key, dimensions, document template, and request/response structures for the Mistral API. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/embedders/mistral.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "mistral": { "source": "rest", "apiKey": "", "dimensions": 1024, "documentTemplate": "", "url": "https://api.mistral.ai/v1/embeddings", "request": { "model": "mistral-embed", "input": ["{{text}}", "{{..}}"] }, "response": { "data": [ { "embedding": "{{embedding}}" }, "{{..}}" ] } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Meilisearch using Homebrew and launching the server DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to install the latest stable release of Meilisearch using Homebrew package manager for MacOS and then launch the Meilisearch server. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/self_hosted/install_meilisearch_locally.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Update brew and install Meilisearch brew update && brew install meilisearch # Launch Meilisearch meilisearch ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Example of JSON Documents with Primary Key in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows a JSON array containing two document examples for a book index. Each document has an 'id' field which serves as the primary key, along with other attributes like title, author, genres, and price. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/getting_started/primary_key.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` [ { "id": 1, "title": "Diary of a Wimpy Kid: Rodrick Rules", "author": "Jeff Kinney", "genres": ["comedy","humor"], "price": 5.00 }, { "id": 2, "title": "Black Leopard, Red Wolf", "author": "Marlon James", "genres": ["fantasy","drama"], "price": 5.00 } ] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Filter Expression Example DESCRIPTION: Filter expression demonstrating how to filter movies by release date and title criteria. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/filtering_and_sorting/filter_search_results.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` filter="release_date > 795484800 AND title = 'Avengers'" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a JSON Document in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to structure a document in JSON format for Meilisearch. It includes various field types such as strings, numbers, and arrays. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/getting_started/documents.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "id": 1564, "title": "Kung Fu Panda", "genres": "Children's Animation", "release-year": 2008, "cast": [ { "Jack Black": "Po" }, { "Jackie Chan": "Monkey" } ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring OpenAI Embedder for Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to configure an OpenAI embedder for Meilisearch using the /settings/embedders API subroute. It sets up the embedder with specific parameters including the source, model, and API key. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/ai_powered_search/retrieve_related_search_results.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl \ -X POST 'MEILISEARCH_URL/indexes/movies/settings/embedders' \ -H "Authorization: Bearer MEILISEARCH_API_KEY" \ -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \ --data-binary '{ "movies-text": { "source": "openAi", "model": "text-embedding-ada-002", "apiKey": "OPENAI_API_KEY", "documentTemplate": "{{title}} {{overview}}" } }' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Search Response Structure in JSON DESCRIPTION: Example of a JSON response from the Meilisearch search API. It includes hits (search results), pagination info, processing time, and the original query. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/search.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "hits": [ { "id": 2770, "title": "American Pie 2", "poster": "https://image.tmdb.org/t/p/w1280/q4LNgUnRfltxzp3gf1MAGiK5LhV.jpg", "overview": "The whole gang are back and as close as ever. They decide to get even closer by spending the summer together at a beach house. They decide to hold the biggest‚Ä¶", "release_date": 997405200 }, { "id": 190859, "title": "American Sniper", "poster": "https://image.tmdb.org/t/p/w1280/svPHnYE7N5NAGO49dBmRhq0vDQ3.jpg", "overview": "U.S. Navy SEAL Chris Kyle takes his sole mission‚Äîprotect his comrades‚Äîto heart and becomes one of the most lethal snipers in American history. His pinpoint accuracy not only saves countless lives but also makes him a prime‚Ä¶", "release_date": 1418256000 }, ‚Ä¶ ], "offset": 0, "limit": 20, "estimatedTotalHits": 976, "processingTimeMs": 35, "query": "american " } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Example of a Single Document with Primary Key in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows a single JSON document example with 'id' as the primary key. The document represents a book with attributes like title, author, genres, and price. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/getting_started/primary_key.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "id": 1, "title": "Diary of a Wimpy Kid", "author": "Jeff Kinney", "genres": ["comedy","humor"], "price": 5.00 } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Cohere Embedder Settings in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet demonstrates how to configure the embedder settings for Cohere in Meilisearch. It includes the API key, dimensions, document template, and request/response structures for the Cohere API. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/embedders/cohere.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "cohere": { "source": "rest", "apiKey": "", "dimensions": 1024, "documentTemplate": "", "url": "https://api.cohere.com/v1/embed", "request": { "model": "embed-english-v3.0", "texts": [ "{{text}}", "{{..}}" ], "input_type": "search_document" }, "response": { "embeddings": [ "{{embedding}}", "{{..}}" ] }, } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Combining Conjunctive and Disjunctive Facets in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates a complex query combining both conjunctive and disjunctive facets. It filters for books in either English or French, that are both Fiction and Literature. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/filtering_and_sorting/facet_types.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` "(language = English OR language = French) AND (genres = Fiction AND genres = Literature)" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring InstantSearch in Vue main.js DESCRIPTION: Code to integrate InstantSearch into the Vue application's main.js file. This imports the Vue InstantSearch library and registers it with the Vue application. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/front_end/vue_quick_start.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: js CODE: ``` import { createApp } from 'vue'; import App from './App.vue'; import InstantSearch from 'vue-instantsearch/vue3/es'; const app = createApp(App); app.use(InstantSearch); app.mount('#app'); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Complete REST Embedder with API Key DESCRIPTION: Creates a complete embedder configuration including the API key for authentication with the provider and a document template for generating embeddings. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/ai_powered_search/configure_rest_embedder.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "EMBEDDER_NAME": { "source": "rest", "url": "PROVIDER_URL", "request": { "model": "MODEL_NAME", "input": ["{{text}}", "{{..}}"], "encoding_format": "float" }, "response": { "data": [ { "embedding": "{{embedding}}" }, "{{..}}" ] }, "apiKey": "PROVIDER_API_KEY", "documentTemplate": "SHORT_AND_RELEVANT_DOCUMENT_TEMPLATE" } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Complete Search UI with Meilisearch in React DESCRIPTION: Builds a complete search interface by adding SearchBox and InfiniteHits components inside the InstantSearch wrapper. Includes a custom Hit component to display each search result and imports styling from instantsearch.css. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/front_end/react_quick_start.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` import React from 'react'; import { InstantSearch, SearchBox, InfiniteHits } from 'react-instantsearch'; import { instantMeiliSearch } from '@meilisearch/instant-meilisearch'; import 'instantsearch.css/themes/satellite.css'; const { searchClient } = instantMeiliSearch( 'https://ms-adf78ae33284-106.lon.meilisearch.io', 'a63da4928426f12639e19d62886f621130f3fa9ff3c7534c5d179f0f51c4f303' ); const App = () => ( ); const Hit = ({ hit }) => (

{hit.name}

${hit.description}

); export default App ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Filtering Meilisearch Search Results DESCRIPTION: Examples of using filter expressions in Meilisearch queries, demonstrating string syntax and array syntax for complex filters. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/search.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` "(genres = horror OR genres = mystery) AND director = 'Jordan Peele'" ``` LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` [["genres = horror", "genres = mystery"], "director = 'Jordan Peele'"] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Meilisearch Dependencies for React DESCRIPTION: Installs the required libraries for integrating Meilisearch search functionality: react-instantsearch for UI components, instant-meilisearch for connecting to Meilisearch, and instantsearch.css for basic styling. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/front_end/react_quick_start.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm install react-instantsearch @meilisearch/instant-meilisearch instantsearch.css ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating an NDJSON Document in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to represent a document in NDJSON format for Meilisearch. NDJSON is a more compact representation where each line is a valid JSON object. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/getting_started/documents.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "id": 1564, "title": "Kung Fu Panda", "genres": "Children's Animation", "release-year": 2008, "cast": [{ "Jack Black": "Po" }, { "Jackie Chan": "Monkey" }] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Tenant Token with Meilisearch JavaScript SDK DESCRIPTION: JavaScript code to generate a tenant token that filters search results based on the patient's name. It uses the Meilisearch JavaScript SDK to create a token with specific search rules for the appointments index. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/multitenancy_nodejs.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: js CODE: ``` // search.js import { Meilisearch } from 'meilisearch' const apiKey = 'YOUR_SEARCH_API_KEY' const apiKeyUid = 'YOUR_SEARCH_API_KEY_UID' const indexName = 'appointments' const client = new Meilisearch({ host: 'https://edge.meilisearch.com', // Your Meilisearch host apiKey: apiKey }) export function createTenantToken(patientName) { const searchRules = { [indexName]: { 'filter': `patient = ${patientName}` } } const tenantToken = client.generateTenantToken( apiKeyUid, searchRules, { expiresAt: new Date('2030-01-01'), // Choose an expiration date apiKey: apiKey, } ) return tenantToken } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Facet Distribution Response Structure DESCRIPTION: Example JSON structure showing facet distribution in search results with document counts per facet value. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/search.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "facetDistribution": { "FACET_A": { "FACET_VALUE_X": 6, "FACET_VALUE_Y": 1 }, "FACET_B": { "FACET_VALUE_Z": 3, "FACET_VALUE_W": 9 } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Index Object Structure in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: Shows the structure of an index object containing basic metadata like uid, creation date, update date and primary key. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/indexes.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "uid": "movies", "createdAt": "2022-02-10T07:45:15.628261Z", "updatedAt": "2022-02-21T15:28:43.496574Z", "primaryKey": "id" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Custom Embedder in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: This curl command configures the embedder index setting with a source of 'userProvided' and specifies the dimensions of the vector space. It sets up a custom embedder named 'image2text' with 3 dimensions. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/ai_powered_search/search_with_user_provided_embeddings.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` curl \ -X PATCH 'MEILISEARCH_URL/indexes/movies/settings' \ -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \ --data-binary '{ "embedders": { "image2text": { "source": "userProvided", "dimensions": 3 } } }' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Meilisearch using Docker DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to pull the latest stable release of Meilisearch Docker image and run it in development mode with a master key. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/self_hosted/install_meilisearch_locally.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Fetch the latest version of Meilisearch image from DockerHub docker pull getmeili/meilisearch:v1.14 # Launch Meilisearch in development mode with a master key docker run -it --rm \ -p 7700:7700 \ -e MEILI_ENV='development' \ -v $(pwd)/meili_data:/meili_data \ getmeili/meilisearch:v1.14 # Use ${pwd} instead of $(pwd) in PowerShell ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Performing Semantic Search with Meilisearch Embedder in JSON DESCRIPTION: This JSON query demonstrates how to perform a semantic search using the configured embedder. It sets the semanticRatio to 1 for pure semantic search and specifies the embedder to use. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/embedders/huggingface.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "q": "QUERY_TERMS", "hybrid": { "semanticRatio": 1, "embedder": "hf-inference" } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Mixed Array and String Filter in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: The same complex filter implemented by mixing array and string syntax for more readable construction. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/filtering_and_sorting/filter_expression_reference.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_28 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` [["genres = comedy", "genres = horror"], "NOT director = 'Jordan Peele'"] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initial Setup and Environment Validation DESCRIPTION: Basic setup code that loads environment variables and validates their presence, including imports and initial configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/langchain.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` # setup.py import os from dotenv import load_dotenv # remove if not using dotenv from langchain.vectorstores import Meilisearch from langchain.embeddings.openai import OpenAIEmbeddings from langchain.document_loaders import JSONLoader load_dotenv() # remove if not using dotenv # exit if missing env vars if "MEILI_HTTP_ADDR" not in os.environ: raise Exception("Missing MEILI_HTTP_ADDR env var") if "MEILI_API_KEY" not in os.environ: raise Exception("Missing MEILI_API_KEY env var") if "OPENAI_API_KEY" not in os.environ: raise Exception("Missing OPENAI_API_KEY env var") # Setup code will go here üëá ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Generic Documentation Search Bar Integration DESCRIPTION: HTML implementation of Meilisearch search functionality for any documentation website, including required CSS and JavaScript setup. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/front_end/search_bar_for_docs.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Converting ISO 8601 Date Format to UNIX Timestamp in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: JavaScript code that converts an ISO 8601 formatted date string to a UNIX timestamp in seconds. The example shows how to use Date.parse() to get milliseconds, then convert to seconds for proper timestamp format. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/filtering_and_sorting/working_with_dates.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: js CODE: ``` let game = { "id": 0, "title": "Return of the Obra Dinn", "genre": "adventure", "release_date": "2018-10-18T00:00Z" }; const timestampInMilliseconds = Date.parse(game.release_date); // Date.parse returns the timestamp in milliseconds const timestamp = timestampInMilliseconds / 1000; // UNIX timestamps must be in seconds game = { "id": 0, "title": "Return of the Obra Dinn", "genre": "adventure", "release_date": "2018-10-18T00:00Z", "release_timestamp": timestamp }; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Search UI with Custom Results Display DESCRIPTION: Complete implementation of a search interface with a search box and customized results display. Includes styling via instantsearch.css and templates for formatting search results with images and descriptions. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/front_end/vue_quick_start.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: js CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Meilisearch Task Object Structure in JSON DESCRIPTION: Example of a complete task object showing the structure and possible values for a failed index deletion operation. The object includes task identification, status, timing, and error details. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/tasks.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "uid": 4, "batchUids": 0, "indexUid": "movie", "status": "failed", "type": "indexDeletion", "canceledBy": null, "details": { "deletedDocuments": 0 }, "error": { "message": "Index `movie` not found.", "code": "index_not_found", "type": "invalid_request", "link": "https://docs.meilisearch.com/errors#index_not_found" }, "duration": "PT0.001192S", "enqueuedAt": "2022-08-04T12:28:15.159167Z", "startedAt": "2022-08-04T12:28:15.161996Z", "finishedAt": "2022-08-04T12:28:15.163188Z" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Complex Filter with Multiple Conditions DESCRIPTION: Advanced filter expression combining multiple conditions with AND/OR operators and parentheses for proper grouping. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/filtering_and_sorting/filter_search_results.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` filter="title = 'Batman' AND (director = 'Tim Burton' OR director = 'Christopher Nolan')" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Downloading Meilisearch Docker Image DESCRIPTION: Command to pull a specific version of the Meilisearch Docker image from Docker Hub. The example uses version v1.14, but users should select their preferred version from the available tags. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/docker.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` docker pull getmeili/meilisearch:v1.14 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Similar Documents Response Format - Meilisearch API DESCRIPTION: Example JSON response format when retrieving similar documents from Meilisearch. Shows the structure including hits array with document details, processing metadata, and pagination information. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/similar.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "hits": [ { "id": "299537", "title": "Captain Marvel" }, { "id": "166428", "title": "How to Train Your Dragon: The Hidden World" } { "id": "287947", "title": "Shazam!" } ], "id": "23", "processingTimeMs": 0, "limit": 20, "offset": 0, "estimatedTotalHits": 3 } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Complex Filter with Parentheses in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: A filter using parentheses to ensure correct operator precedence, returning comedy and horror movies released after March 1995. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/filtering_and_sorting/filter_expression_reference.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_22 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` (genres = horror OR genres = comedy) AND release_date > 795484800 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Meilisearch Component with Vue DESCRIPTION: This Vue component initializes a Meilisearch client using the provided host, API key, and index name. It wraps the InstantSearch component and allows for custom content via slots. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/laravel_multitenancy.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: vue CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Key Object Structure in JSON for Meilisearch API DESCRIPTION: This JSON object represents the structure of a key in Meilisearch. It includes properties such as name, description, key, uid, actions, indexes, expiresAt, createdAt, and updatedAt. This structure is used when creating, retrieving, or managing API keys. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/keys.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "name": "Default Search API Key", "description": "Use it to search from the frontend code", "key": "0a6e572506c52ab0bd6195921575d23092b7f0c284ab4ac86d12346c33057f99", "uid": "74c9c733-3368-4738-bbe5-1d18a5fecb37", "actions": [ "search" ], "indexes": [ "*" ], "expiresAt": null, "createdAt": "2021-08-11T10:00:00Z", "updatedAt": "2021-08-11T10:00:00Z" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Documents to Meilisearch Index (JSON) DESCRIPTION: Example of the JSON body for adding or replacing documents in a Meilisearch index. It demonstrates the structure of a document with fields like id, title, poster, overview, and release_date. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/documents.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` [ { "id": 287947, "title": "Shazam", "poster": "https://image.tmdb.org/t/p/w1280/xnopI5Xtky18MPhK40cZAGAOVeV.jpg", "overview": "A boy is given the ability to become an adult superhero in times of need with a single magic word.", "release_date": "2019-03-23" } ] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Meilisearch Using the Command-Line Installer DESCRIPTION: Downloads and runs the Meilisearch installer script to get the latest version of Meilisearch. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/running_production.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` # Install Meilisearch latest version from the script curl -L https://install.meilisearch.com | sh ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Complex String Filter in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: A complex filter using string syntax and parentheses to return comedy or horror movies not directed by Jordan Peele. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/filtering_and_sorting/filter_expression_reference.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_27 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` "(genres = comedy OR genres = horror) AND director != 'Jordan Peele'" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Documents in Meilisearch (JSON) DESCRIPTION: Example of updating an existing document in Meilisearch. It shows how to partially update a document by providing only the fields that need to be changed or added. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/documents.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` [ { "id": 287947, "title": "Shazam ‚ö°Ô∏è" } ] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Data Persistence with Docker Volumes DESCRIPTION: Command to run Meilisearch with a mounted volume for data persistence. This ensures data is retained between container restarts by storing it in the host machine's directory. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/docker.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` docker run -it --rm \ -p 7700:7700 \ -v $(pwd)/meili_data:/meili_data \ getmeili/meilisearch:v1.14 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Default Meilisearch Settings Object in JSON DESCRIPTION: The default structure of the settings object for a Meilisearch index. This shows all available fields that can be modified. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/settings.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "displayedAttributes": [ "*" ], "searchableAttributes": [ "*" ], "filterableAttributes": [], "sortableAttributes": [], "rankingRules": [ "words", "typo", "proximity", "attribute", "sort", "exactness" ], "stopWords": [], "nonSeparatorTokens": [], "separatorTokens": [], "dictionary": [], "synonyms": {}, "distinctAttribute": null, "typoTolerance": { "enabled": true, "minWordSizeForTypos": { "oneTypo": 5, "twoTypos": 9 }, "disableOnWords": [], "disableOnAttributes": [] }, "faceting": { "maxValuesPerFacet": 100 }, "pagination": { "maxTotalHits": 1000 }, "proximityPrecision": "byWord", "facetSearch": true, "prefixSearch": "indexingTime", "searchCutoffMs": null, "embedders": {} } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initializing the Meilisearch Client in React DESCRIPTION: Sets up the instantMeiliSearch client to connect to a Meilisearch instance containing Steam video game data. This initializes the search client with a URL and API key for authentication. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/front_end/react_quick_start.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` import React from 'react'; import { instantMeiliSearch } from '@meilisearch/instant-meilisearch'; const { searchClient } = instantMeiliSearch( 'https://ms-adf78ae33284-106.lon.meilisearch.io', 'a63da4928426f12639e19d62886f621130f3fa9ff3c7534c5d179f0f51c4f303' ); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Preparing JSON Documents for Geosearch in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: Example of how to structure JSON documents with _geo fields for geosearch functionality in Meilisearch. The _geo field must contain an object with lat and lng keys representing latitude and longitude. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/filtering_and_sorting/geosearch.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "id": 1, "name": "N√†piz' Milano", "address": "Viale Vittorio Veneto, 30, 20124, Milan, Italy", "type": "pizza", "rating": 9, "_geo": { "lat": 45.4777599, "lng": 9.1967508 } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Ranking Score Response Example in JSON DESCRIPTION: Example JSON response showing search results with ranking scores for a 'dragon' query, demonstrating how Meilisearch assigns relevance scores to search results. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/search.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "hits": [ { "id": 31072, "title": "Dragon", "overview": "In a desperate attempt to save her kingdom‚Ä¶", "_rankingScore": 0.92 }, { "id": 70057, "title": "Dragon", "overview": "A sinful martial arts expert wants‚Ä¶", "_rankingScore": 0.91 } ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: OR Operator Filter in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: A filter combining two conditions with OR to return documents that are either horror or comedy. This command sends a request to the /health endpoint over HTTPS and expects a 200 OK response with a specific body. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/ai_powered_search/getting_started_with_ai_search.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` curl \ -X POST 'MEILISEARCH_URL/indexes/kitchenware/search' \ -H 'content-type: application/json' \ --data-binary '{ "q": "kitchen utensils made of wood", "hybrid": { "embedder": "products-openai" } }' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Document Import and Embedding Generation DESCRIPTION: Code for loading JSON documents, generating OpenAI embeddings, and storing them in Meilisearch with vector search configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/langchain.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` # setup.py # previous code # Load documents loader = JSONLoader( file_path="./movies-lite.json", jq_schema=".[] | {id: .id, overview: .overview, title: .title}", text_content=False, ) documents = loader.load() print("Loaded {} documents".format(len(documents))) # Store documents in Meilisearch embeddings = OpenAIEmbeddings() embedders = { "custom": { "source": "userProvided", "dimensions": 1536 } } embedder_name = "custom" vector_store = Meilisearch.from_documents(documents=documents, embedding=embeddings, embedders=embedders, embedder_name=embedder_name) print("Started importing documents") ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Similarity Search Implementation DESCRIPTION: Implementation of semantic similarity search using the configured vector store and OpenAI embeddings to find similar documents. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/langchain.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` # search.py import os from dotenv import load_dotenv from langchain.vectorstores import Meilisearch from langchain.embeddings.openai import OpenAIEmbeddings import meilisearch load_dotenv() # You can use the same code as `setup.py` to check for missing env vars # Create the vector store client = meilisearch.Client( url=os.environ.get("MEILI_HTTP_ADDR"), api_key=os.environ.get("MEILI_API_KEY"), ) embeddings = OpenAIEmbeddings() vector_store = Meilisearch(client=client, embedding=embeddings) # Make similarity search embedder_name = "custom" query = "superhero fighting evil in a city at night" results = vector_store.similarity_search( query=query, embedder_name=embedder_name, k=3, ) # Display results for result in results: print(result.page_content) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Array Filter with OR Logic in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: A filter using nested array syntax where inner elements are connected by OR, returning horror or comedy movies. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/filtering_and_sorting/filter_expression_reference.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_25 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` [["genres = horror", "genres = comedy"]] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Meilisearch for Production Use DESCRIPTION: Updates the Meilisearch configuration file with production settings, including master key and data storage paths. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/running_production.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` env = "production" master_key = "MASTER_KEY" db_path = "/var/lib/meilisearch/data" dump_dir = "/var/lib/meilisearch/dumps" snapshot_dir = "/var/lib/meilisearch/snapshots" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initialize Embedder Configuration - JSON DESCRIPTION: Basic embedder object configuration with a custom name for use with Meilisearch. It reads a JSON dataset, splits the 'text' field by paragraphs, and creates new documents for each paragraph. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/improve_relevancy_large_documents.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` #!/usr/bin/env node const datasetPath = process.argv[2]; const datasetFile = fs.readFileSync(datasetPath); const documents = JSON.parse(datasetFile); const splitDocuments = []; for (let documentNumber = documents.length, i = 0; i < documentNumber; i += 1) { const document = documents[i]; const story = document.text; const paragraphs = story.split("\n\n"); for (let paragraphNumber = paragraphs.length, o = 0; o < paragraphNumber; o += 1) { splitDocuments.push({ "id": document.id, "title": document.title, "author": document.author, "text": paragraphs[o] }); } } fs.writeFileSync("stories-split.json", JSON.stringify(splitDocuments)); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Performing Semantic Search with Meilisearch API DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet shows how to structure a semantic search request using the Meilisearch API. It includes the search query and hybrid search configuration with semantic ratio and embedder specification. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/security/tenant_token_reference.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "exp": 1646756934, "apiKeyUid": "at5cd97d-5a4b-4226-a868-2d0eb6d197ab", "searchRules": { "INDEX_NAME": { "filter": "attribute = value" } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Fetching data from Algolia index DESCRIPTION: JavaScript code to fetch all documents from an Algolia index using the browseObjects method. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/update_and_migration/algolia_migration.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` let records = []; await algoliaIndex.browseObjects({ batch: (hits) => { records = records.concat(hits); } }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Meilisearch Documentation Scraper DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration file for the docs-scraper tool that defines how to extract content from documentation pages, including index settings and content selectors. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/front_end/search_bar_for_docs.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "index_uid": "docs", "start_urls": [ "https://www.example.com/doc/" ], "sitemap_urls": [ "https://www.example.com/sitemap.xml" ], "stop_urls": [], "selectors": { "lvl0": { "selector": ".docs-lvl0", "global": true, "default_value": "Documentation" }, "lvl1": { "selector": ".docs-lvl1", "global": true, "default_value": "Chapter" }, "lvl2": ".docs-content .docs-lvl2", "lvl3": ".docs-content .docs-lvl3", "lvl4": ".docs-content .docs-lvl4", "lvl5": ".docs-content .docs-lvl5", "lvl6": ".docs-content .docs-lvl6", "text": ".docs-content p, .docs-content li" } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating an Express.js Server for Tenant Tokens DESCRIPTION: JavaScript code that sets up an Express.js server with an endpoint to generate and serve tenant tokens. The endpoint accepts a patient ID as a query parameter and returns a token specific to that patient. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/multitenancy_nodejs.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: js CODE: ``` // server.js import express from 'express' import { createTenantToken } from './search.js' const server = express() server.get('/token', async (request, response) => { const { id: patientId } = request.query const token = createTenantToken(patientId) return response.json({ token }); }) server.listen(3000, () => { console.log('Server is running on port 3000') }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Nested Object Attribute Ranking in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: Shows how to configure ranking order for nested object attributes using dot notation. This configuration gives different weights to nested fields, with 'review.critic' having higher priority than 'review.user'. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/relevancy/attribute_ranking_order.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` [ "title", "review.critic", "overview", "review.user" ] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Documents with Function in Meilisearch (Shell) DESCRIPTION: Example of using a RHAI function to update documents in Meilisearch. It demonstrates how to use the experimental feature to edit documents by applying a function to the title field. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/documents.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` curl \ -X POST 'MEILISEARCH_URL/indexes/INDEX_NAME/documents/edit' \ -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \ --data-binary '{ "function": "doc.title = `${doc.title.to_upper()}`" }' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enhanced Organization Model with Meilisearch Tenant Token Generation in PHP DESCRIPTION: This code extends the Organization model to automatically generate and store Meilisearch tenant tokens. It uses Laravel's model events to generate tokens when organizations are retrieved from the database, ensuring data access is restricted by organization_id. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/laravel_multitenancy.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: php CODE: ``` hasMany(Contact::class); } protected static function booted() { static::retrieved(function (Organization $organization) { // You may want to add some logic to skip generating tokens in certain environments if (env('SCOUT_DRIVER') === 'array' && env('APP_ENV') === 'testing') { $organization->meilisearch_token = 'fake-tenant-token'; return; } // Early return if the organization already has a token if ($organization->meilisearch_token) { Log::debug('Organization ' . $organization->id . ': already has a token'); return; } Log::debug('Generating tenant token for organization ID: ' . $organization->id); // The object belows is used to generate a tenant token that: // ‚Ä¢ applies to all indexes // ‚Ä¢ filters only documents where `organization_id` is equal to this org ID $searchRules = (object) [ '*' => (object) [ 'filter' => 'organization_id = ' . $organization->id, ] ]; // Replace with your own Search API key and API key UID $meiliApiKey = env('MEILISEARCH_SEARCH_KEY'); $meiliApiKeyUid = env('MEILISEARCH_SEARCH_KEY_UID'); // Generate the token $token = self::generateMeiliTenantToken($meiliApiKeyUid, $searchRules, $meiliApiKey); // Save the token in the database $organization->meilisearch_token = $token; $organization->save(); }); } protected static function generateMeiliTenantToken($meiliApiKeyUid, $searchRules, $meiliApiKey) { $meilisearch = resolve(EngineManager::class)->engine(); return $meilisearch->generateTenantToken( $meiliApiKeyUid, $searchRules, [ 'apiKey' => $meiliApiKey, 'expiresAt' => new DateTime('2030-12-31'), ] ); } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Comparison Operator Filter in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: A filter using the greater than operator to return documents with a user rating above 85. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/filtering_and_sorting/filter_expression_reference.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` rating.users > 85 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: NOT Operator Filter in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: A filter using the NOT operator to return documents whose 'genres' field doesn't contain 'horror' and documents with a missing 'genres' field. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/filtering_and_sorting/filter_expression_reference.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` NOT genres = horror ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring REST Embedder with Hugging Face Inference Endpoints in JSON DESCRIPTION: This JSON configuration sets up a Meilisearch embedder that connects to a Hugging Face Inference Endpoint. It includes the API connection details, embedding dimensions, document template, and request/response structure for the model. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/embedders/huggingface.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "hf-inference": { "source": "rest", "url": "ENDPOINT_URL", "apiKey": "API_KEY", "dimensions": 384, "documentTemplate": "CUSTOM_LIQUID_TEMPLATE", "request": { "inputs": ["{{text}}", "{{..}}"], "model": "baai/bge-small-en-v1.5" }, "response": ["{{embedding}}", "{{..}}"] } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Generating Tenant Token with Third-Party JWT Library DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to generate a Meilisearch tenant token using the node-jsonwebtoken library. Demonstrates setting up token payload with search rules, API key UID, and expiration time. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/security/tenant_tokens.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` const jwt = require('jsonwebtoken'); const apiKey = 'my_api_key'; const apiKeyUid = 'ac5cd97d-5a4b-4226-a868-2d0eb6d197ab'; const currentUserID = 'a_user_id'; const tokenPayload = { searchRules: { 'patient_medical_records': { 'filter': `user_id = ${currentUserID}` } }, apiKeyUid: apiKeyUid, exp: parseInt(Date.now() / 1000) + 20 * 60 // 20 minutes }; const token = jwt.sign(tokenPayload, apiKey, {algorithm: 'HS256'}); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Performing Hybrid Search with User-Provided Embeddings in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: This curl command shows how to perform a hybrid search in Meilisearch, combining vector search with traditional text search. It includes both the vectorized query and a text query. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/ai_powered_search/image_search_with_user_provided_embeddings.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` curl -X POST -H 'content-type: application/json' \ 'localhost:7700/indexes/products/search' \ --data-binary '{ "vector": VECTORIZED_QUERY, "hybrid": { "embedder": "EMBEDDER_NAME", } "q": "QUERY", }' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Add OpenAI API Key - JSON DESCRIPTION: Complete embedder configuration including OpenAI API key for authentication. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/ai_powered_search/getting_started_with_ai_search.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "products-openai": { "source": "openAi", "model": "text-embedding-3-small", "apiKey": "OPEN_AI_API_KEY" } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Faceted Search Response Structure DESCRIPTION: Example of a Meilisearch search response showing facetDistribution and facetStats fields. facetDistribution lists all facets in the results with document counts, while facetStats provides min/max values for numeric facets. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/filtering_and_sorting/search_with_facet_filters.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "hits": [ ‚Ä¶ ], ‚Ä¶ "facetDistribution": { "genres": { "Classics": 6, ‚Ä¶ }, "language": { "English": 6, "French": 1, "Spanish": 1 }, "rating": { "2.5": 1, ‚Ä¶ } }, "facetStats": { "rating": { "min": 2.5, "max": 4.7 } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Matches Position Response Example in JSON DESCRIPTION: Example JSON response showing matches position information for a search query 'winter feast', demonstrating how Meilisearch handles word matching and position tracking in search results. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/search.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "id": 50393, "title": "Kung Fu Panda Holiday", "poster": "https://image.tmdb.org/t/p/w500/rV77WxY35LuYLOuQvBeD1nyWMuI.jpg", "overview": "The Winter Feast is Po's favorite holiday. Every year he and his father hang decorations, cook together, and serve noodle soup to the villagers. But this year Shifu informs Po that as Dragon Warrior, it is his duty to host the formal Winter Feast at the Jade Palace. Po is caught between his obligations as the Dragon Warrior and his family traditions: between Shifu and Mr. Ping.", "release_date": 1290729600, "_matchesPosition": { "overview": [ { "start": 4, "length": 6 }, { "start": 11, "length": 5 }, { "start": 234, "length": 6 }, { "start": 241, "length": 5 } ] } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Filtering Medical Indexes with Wildcard in JSON DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates using a wildcard at the end of an index name to apply rules to all indexes starting with 'medical', filtering results by user_id and published status. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/security/tenant_tokens.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "medical*": { "filter": "user_id = 1 AND published = true" } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Meilisearch client and initializing index DESCRIPTION: JavaScript code to create a Meilisearch client and initialize an index using the host URL and API key. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/update_and_migration/algolia_migration.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` const { MeiliSearch } = require("meilisearch"); const meiliClient = new MeiliSearch({ host: "MEILI_HOST", apiKey: "MEILI_API_KEY", }); const meiliIndex = meiliClient.index("MEILI_INDEX_NAME"); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Negated IN Operator Filters in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: Two equivalent ways to write a negated IN filter that returns documents where 'genres' doesn't include 'horror' or 'comedy'. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/filtering_and_sorting/filter_expression_reference.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` genres NOT IN [horror, comedy] NOT genres IN [horror, comedy] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Meilisearch Index Settings with REST Embedder DESCRIPTION: Updates a Meilisearch index with the configured REST embedder using the cURL command. This is the final step to apply the embedder to your index. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/ai_powered_search/configure_rest_embedder.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` curl \ -X PATCH 'MEILISEARCH_URL/indexes/INDEX_NAME/settings/embedders' \ -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \ --data-binary '{ "EMBEDDER_NAME": { "source": "rest", "url": "PROVIDER_URL", "request": { "model": "MODEL_NAME", "input": ["{{text}}", "{{..}}"], }, "response": { "data": [ { "embedding": "{{embedding}}" }, "{{..}}" ] }, "apiKey": "PROVIDER_API_KEY", "documentTemplate": "SHORT_AND_RELEVANT_DOCUMENT_TEMPLATE" } }' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Summarized Task Object in Meilisearch JSON DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates a summarized version of the task object returned by Meilisearch after an API request for an asynchronous operation. It includes essential fields like taskUid, indexUid, status, type, and enqueuedAt timestamp. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/async/asynchronous_operations.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "taskUid": 0, "indexUid": "movies", "status": "enqueued", "type": "indexCreation", "enqueuedAt": "2021-08-11T09:25:53.000000Z" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring facetsByIndex for Multi-search in Meilisearch API (JSON) DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to structure the facetsByIndex object in a multi-search request. It specifies which attributes to use for faceting in each index. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/multi_search.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` "facetsByIndex": { "INDEX_A": ["ATTRIBUTE_X", "ATTRIBUTE_Y"], "INDEX_B": ["ATTRIBUTE_Z"] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Negative Filter Expression DESCRIPTION: Filter expression using NOT operator to exclude specific results while including other conditions. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/filtering_and_sorting/filter_search_results.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` filter="release_date > 1577884550 AND NOT director = 'Tim Burton'" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: IS NULL Operator Filter in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: A filter that returns documents where the 'overview' field exists but contains a null value. It sets the searchable attributes to 'title' and 'overview'. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/configuration/configuring_index_settings_api.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl \ -X PUT 'http://localhost:7700/indexes/INDEX_NAME/settings/searchable-attributes' \ -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \ -H 'Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY' \ --data-binary '["title", "overview"]' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Performing Semantic Search with Meilisearch JSON DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet shows how to perform a semantic search using Meilisearch. It includes the search query and hybrid search configuration with semantic ratio and embedder specification. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/search.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "hits": [ { "id": 0, "title": "DOCUMENT NAME", "_vectors": { "default": { "embeddings": [0.1, 0.2, 0.3], "regenerate": true } } ‚Ä¶ }, ‚Ä¶ ], ‚Ä¶ } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Performing Semantic Search with Voyage AI Embeddings in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: JSON request configuration for executing a semantic search query in Meilisearch using Voyage AI embeddings. It demonstrates how to set the semantic ratio and specify the embedder to use. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/embedders/voyage.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "q": "", "hybrid": { "semanticRatio": 1, "embedder": "voyage" } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring REST Embedder Request Format in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: Example JSON configuration showing how to define the request structure for a REST embedder. The '{{text}}' placeholder is used to indicate where Meilisearch should insert the text to be embedded. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/settings.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_58 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "source": "rest", "request": { "prompt": "{{text}}" ‚Ä¶ }, ‚Ä¶ } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Advanced Vector Search with Filter and Sort Parameters DESCRIPTION: This curl command demonstrates an advanced vector search that combines vector search with filtering and sorting capabilities. It searches using a vector, filters results by price, and sorts the results by price in ascending order. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/ai_powered_search/search_with_user_provided_embeddings.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` curl -X POST -H 'content-type: application/json' \ 'localhost:7700/indexes/products/search' \ --data-binary '{ "vector": [0, 1, 2], "filter": "price < 10", "sort": ["price:asc"] }' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Attribute Ranking Configuration in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to configure searchable attributes in order of importance, where attributes listed earlier have higher relevancy weight in search results. In this example, 'title' has the highest priority, followed by 'overview' and 'release_date'. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/relevancy/attribute_ranking_order.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` [ "title", "overview", "release_date" ] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Filterable and Sortable Attributes in Scout Config DESCRIPTION: PHP configuration for specifying filterable and sortable attributes in the Scout configuration file. This determines which fields can be used for filtering and sorting in Meilisearch. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/laravel_scout.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: php CODE: ``` [ 'host' => env('MEILISEARCH_HOST', 'https://edge.meilisearch.com'), 'key' => env('MEILISEARCH_KEY'), 'index-settings' => [ Contact::class => [ 'filterableAttributes' => ['organization_id'], 'sortableAttributes' => ['name', 'company_name'] ], ], ], ]; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Facet Stats Response Structure DESCRIPTION: Example JSON structure showing minimum and maximum numerical values for facets in search results. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/search.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "facetStats": { "rating": { "min": 2.5, "max": 4.7 } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Weighted Federated Search Request in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: Performs a federated search with boosted weights for the profiles index to prioritize certain results. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/multi_search/performing_federated_search.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` curl \ -X POST 'MEILISEARCH_URL/multi-search' \ -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \ --data-binary '{ "federation": {}, "queries": [ { "indexUid": "chats", "q": "rotondo" }, { "indexUid": "profiles", "q": "rotondo", "federationOptions": { "weight": 1.2 } }, { "indexUid": "tickets", "q": "rotondo" } ] }' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Customizing Searchable Data with Relationships DESCRIPTION: Advanced example showing how to customize searchable data by implementing the toSearchableArray method. This example demonstrates including relationship data in the searchable document. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/laravel_scout.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: php CODE: ``` belongsTo(Company::class); } public function toSearchableArray(): array { // All model attributes are made searchable $array = $this->toArray(); // Then we add some additional fields $array['organization_id'] = $this->company->organization->id; $array['company_name'] = $this->company->name; $array['company_url'] = $this->company->url; return $array; } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Distribution Parameters for Embedder in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: Example of configuring an embedder with distribution parameters to correct ranking scores. Shows how to set mean and sigma values to improve semantic search relevancy using a HuggingFace model. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/settings.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_62 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` curl \ -X PATCH 'MEILISEARCH_URL/indexes/INDEX_NAME/settings' \ -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \ --data-binary '{ "embedders": { "default": { "source": "huggingFace", "model": "MODEL_NAME", "distribution": { "mean": 0.7, "sigma": 0.3 } } } }' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Single Filter Search Rule Example DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates a search rule with a single filter for a specific index. It restricts access to documents based on a user_id attribute. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/security/tenant_token_reference.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "medical_records": { "filter": "user_id = 1" } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Mutual Synonym Association in Meilisearch JSON DESCRIPTION: This code shows how to create a mutual association between multiple synonyms in Meilisearch settings. It sets 'shoe', 'boot', 'slipper', and 'sneakers' as synonyms for each other. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/relevancy/synonyms.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "shoe": [ "boot", "slipper", "sneakers" ], "boot": [ "shoe", "slipper", "sneakers" ], "slipper": [ "shoe", "boot", "sneakers" ], "sneakers": [ "shoe", "boot", "slipper" ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Similar Documents in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to use Meilisearch's /similar route to find documents similar to a specific movie. It requires a vectorized query and the name of the configured embedder. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/ai_powered_search/image_search_with_user_provided_embeddings.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` curl -X POST -H 'content-type: application/json' \ 'localhost:7700/indexes/products/search' \ --data-binary '{ "vector": VECTORIZED_QUERY, "hybrid": { "embedder": "EMBEDDER_NAME", } }' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Combining Multiple Filters for Meilisearch Tasks DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates combining multiple filters to retrieve specific Meilisearch tasks. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/async/filtering_tasks.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl \ -X GET 'http://localhost:7700/tasks?indexUid=movies&types=documentAdditionOrUpdate,documentDeletion&statuses=processing' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring REST Embedder for Batch Processing in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: Example JSON configuration for a REST embedder that handles multiple documents in a single request. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/security/generate_tenant_token_third_party.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` const jwt = require('jsonwebtoken'); const apiKey = 'API_KEY'; const apiKeyUid = 'API_KEY_UID'; const currentUserID = 'USER_ID'; const expiryDate = parseInt(Date.now() / 1000) + 20 * 60; // 20 minutes const tokenPayload = { searchRules: { 'INDEX_NAME': { 'filter': `user_id = ${currentUserID}` } }, apiKeyUid: apiKeyUid, exp: expiryDate }; const token = jwt.sign(tokenPayload, apiKey, {algorithm: 'HS256'}); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Launching Meilisearch Server DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Meilisearch server with a master key for security SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/self_hosted/getting_started_with_self_hosted_meilisearch.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ./meilisearch --master-key="aSampleMasterKey" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Update Ranking Rules Body Format DESCRIPTION: The format for the request body when updating ranking rules, showing that it should be an array of strings representing the rules in order of importance. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/settings.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_32 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` [, , ‚Ä¶] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Dynamic Page Number Buttons with Meilisearch Search Results DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to create a numbered page list using Meilisearch's search response data. The code generates page buttons dynamically, highlights the current page, and uses the totalPages and page properties from the search results. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/front_end/pagination.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` const pageNavigation = document.querySelector('#page-navigation'); const listContainer = pageNavigation.querySelector('#page-list'); const results = await index.search( "tarkovsky", { hitsPerPage: 25, page: 1 } ); const totalPages = results.totalPages; const currentPage = results.page; for (let i = 0; i < totalPages; i += 1) { const listItem = document.createElement('li'); const pageButton = document.createElement('button'); pageButton.innerHTML = i; if (currentPage === i) { listItem.classList.add("current-page"); } listItem.append(pageButton); listContainer.append(listItem); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Negated EXISTS Operator Filters in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: Two equivalent ways to write a negated EXISTS filter that returns documents where the 'release_date' field doesn't exist. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/filtering_and_sorting/filter_expression_reference.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` release_date NOT EXISTS NOT release_date EXISTS ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Single Document Embedding Request DESCRIPTION: Sets up a request configuration for embedding individual documents. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/update_and_migration/algolia_migration.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` const algoliaSearch = require("algoliasearch"); const { MeiliSearch } = require("meilisearch"); const BATCH_SIZE = 1000; (async () => { const algoliaClient = algoliaSearch("APPLICATION_ID", "ADMIN_API_KEY"); const algoliaIndex = algoliaClient.initIndex("INDEX_NAME"); let records = []; await algoliaIndex.browseObjects({ batch: (hits) => { records = records.concat(hits); } }); const meiliClient = new MeiliSearch({ host: "MEILI_HOST", apiKey: "MEILI_API_KEY", }); const meiliIndex = meiliClient.index("MEILI_INDEX_NAME"); await meiliIndex.addDocumentsInBatches(records, BATCH_SIZE); })(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Environment Variables for Meilisearch in Windows DESCRIPTION: Shows how to set environment variables to configure Meilisearch's database path and HTTP address before launching the instance on Windows systems. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring REST Embedder URL in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: Adds the provider URL to a REST embedder configuration. The URL specifies where Meilisearch should send requests to generate embeddings. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/ai_powered_search/configure_rest_embedder.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "EMBEDDER_NAME": { "source": "rest", "url": "PROVIDER_URL" } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Swap Indexes Response DESCRIPTION: Task response returned when swapping two or more indexes. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/indexes.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "taskUid": 3, "indexUid": null, "status": "enqueued", "type": "indexSwap", "enqueuedAt": "2021-08-12T10:00:00.000000Z" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Meilisearch with Webhook URL DESCRIPTION: This command starts Meilisearch with a configured webhook URL to receive task completion notifications. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/async/task_webhook.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` meilisearch --task-webhook-url http://localhost:8000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling Navigation Buttons for First and Last Pages in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: This JavaScript snippet demonstrates how to disable 'Previous' and 'Next' buttons when the user is on the first or last page of search results. It uses the Meilisearch SDK to perform searches and update button states. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/front_end/pagination.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` function updatePageNumber() { const pageNumber = parseInt(document.querySelector('.pagination').dataset.pageNumber) const offset = pageNumber * 20 const results = await index.search('x', { limit: 21, offset }) // If offset equals 0, we're on the first results page if (offset === 0 ) { document.querySelector('#previous_button').disabled = true; } // If offset is bigger than 0, we're not on the first results page if (offset > 0 ) { document.querySelector('#previous_button').disabled = false; } // If Meilisearch returns 20 items or fewer, // we are on the last page if (results.hits.length < 21 ) { document.querySelector('#next_button').disabled = true; } // If Meilisearch returns exactly 21 results // and our page can only show 20 items at a time, // we have at least one more page with one result in it if (results.hits.length === 21 ) { document.querySelector('#next_button').disabled = false; } } document.querySelector('#previous_button').onclick = function () { updatePageNumber(this) } document.querySelector('#next_button').onclick = function () { updatePageNumber(this) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Contact Model with Laravel Scout for Meilisearch in PHP DESCRIPTION: This code defines a Contact model that uses Laravel Scout's Searchable trait for Meilisearch integration. It establishes a belongsTo relationship with the Organization model. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/laravel_multitenancy.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: php CODE: ``` belongsTo(Organization::class, 'organization_id'); } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Batch Document Embedding Request DESCRIPTION: Sets up a request configuration for embedding multiple documents in a single API call. The {{..}} placeholder enables batch processing of up to 10 documents. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/ai_powered_search/configure_rest_embedder.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "EMBEDDER_NAME": { "source": "rest", "url": "PROVIDER_URL", "request": { "model": "MODEL_NAME", "input": [ "{{text}}", "{{..}}" ] } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Multiple Filters Search Rule Example DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to apply multiple filters in a search rule for an index. It combines user_id and published status conditions. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/security/tenant_token_reference.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "medical_records": { "filter": "user_id = 1 AND published = true" } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Synchronizing Index Settings with Artisan Command DESCRIPTION: Artisan command to synchronize index settings between Laravel Scout and Meilisearch. Required after changing index configuration to apply the changes. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/laravel_scout.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` php artisan scout:sync-index-settings ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Activating Composite Embedders in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: Shell command for activating the experimental composite embedders feature in Meilisearch. This command uses the PATCH method to enable the compositeEmbedders feature via the experimental-features endpoint. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/settings.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_57 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` curl \ -X PATCH 'MEILISEARCH_URL/experimental-features/' \ -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \ --data-binary '{ "compositeEmbedders": true }' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Launching Meilisearch with Master Key (CLI) DESCRIPTION: Command to launch a self-hosted Meilisearch instance with a master key using the command-line interface. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/security/basic_security.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` ./meilisearch --master-key="MASTER_KEY" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Body Format for Updating Non-Separator Tokens in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: Shows the expected format for configuring non-separator tokens. An array of strings is provided where each string represents a token to be removed from the default separator list. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/settings.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_45 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` ["@", "#"] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: API Actions Configuration Table - Markdown DESCRIPTION: Table defining all available API actions for Meilisearch API keys, including their access permissions and endpoint restrictions. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/keys.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | Name | Description | | :--------------------- | :--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | **`search`** | Provides access to both [`POST`](/reference/api/search#search-in-an-index-with-post) and [`GET`](/reference/api/search#search-in-an-index-with-get) search endpoints | | **`documents.add`** | Provides access to the [add documents](/reference/api/documents#add-or-replace-documents) and [update documents](/reference/api/documents#add-or-update-documents) endpoints | | **`documents.get`** | Provides access to the [get one document](/reference/api/documents#get-one-document), [get documents with POST](/reference/api/documents#get-documents-with-post), and [get documents with GET](/reference/api/documents#get-documents-with-get) endpoints | | **`documents.delete`** | Provides access to the [delete one document](/reference/api/documents#delete-one-document), [delete all documents](/reference/api/documents#delete-all-documents), [batch delete](/reference/api/documents#delete-documents-by-batch), and [delete by filter](/reference/api/documents#delete-documents-by-filter) endpoints | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring User-Provided Embedder in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: This curl command configures the embedder index setting in Meilisearch, setting its source to 'userProvided'. It requires specifying an embedder name and the number of dimensions for the chosen model. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/ai_powered_search/image_search_with_user_provided_embeddings.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` curl \ -X PATCH 'MEILISEARCH_URL/indexes/movies/settings' \ -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \ --data-binary '{ "embedders": { "EMBEDDER_NAME": { "source": "userProvided", "dimensions": MODEL_DIMENSIONS } } }' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Search Rules for Tenant Tokens in JSON DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the structure of search rules for tenant tokens. Rules are defined as JSON objects with index names as keys and search parameters as values. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/security/tenant_tokens.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "[index_name]": { "[search_parameter]": "[value]" } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Authorization Header Example in Meilisearch API DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to include the Authorization header with a valid API key to access protected routes in Meilisearch. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/self_hosted/install_meilisearch_locally.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Add Meilisearch package echo "deb [trusted=yes] https://apt.fury.io/meilisearch/ /" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/fury.list # Update APT and install Meilisearch sudo apt update && sudo apt install meilisearch # Launch Meilisearch meilisearch ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Specific Meilisearch Version (Cloud Platforms) DESCRIPTION: Command to install a specific version of Meilisearch on cloud platforms. This allows users to choose the exact version they want to migrate to. It includes document data, offset, limit, and total count. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/documents.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "results": [ { "title": "The Travels of Ibn Battuta", "genres": [ "Travel", "Adventure" ], "language": "English", "rating": 4.5 }, { "title": "Pride and Prejudice", "genres": [ "Classics", "Fiction", "Romance", "Literature" ], "language": "English", "rating": 4 }, ‚Ä¶ ], "offset": 0, "limit": 3, "total": 5 } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Network Object Structure in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: This JSON object represents the structure of a network configuration in Meilisearch, including the 'self' identifier and 'remotes' object containing information about remote instances. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/overview.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` cat ~/movies.json | gzip | curl -X POST 'MEILISEARCH_URL/indexes/movies/documents' --data-binary @- -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -H 'Content-Encoding: gzip' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Inequality Operator Filter in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: A filter using the inequality operator to return all documents that don't have 'action' in their genres field. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/filtering_and_sorting/filter_expression_reference.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` director = 'Jordan Peele' director = "Tim Burton" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Generating Unique IDs for Split Documents in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: Updated Node.js script that generates unique IDs for split documents. It creates a 'story_id' field to maintain the original document's ID and generates a new unique ID for each split document. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/improve_relevancy_large_documents.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` #!/usr/bin/env node const datasetPath = process.argv[2]; const datasetFile = fs.readFileSync(datasetPath); const documents = JSON.parse(datasetFile); const splitDocuments = []; for (let documentNumber = documents.length, i = 0; i < documentNumber; i += 1) { const document = documents[i]; const story = document.text; const paragraphs = story.split("\n\n"); for (let paragraphNumber = paragraphs.length, o = 0; o < paragraphNumber; o += 1) { splitDocuments.push({ "story_id": document.id, "id": `${document.id}-${o}`, "title": document.title, "author": document.author, "text": paragraphs[o] }); } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Meilisearch Credentials DESCRIPTION: Ruby code to configure Meilisearch URL and API key in the Rails application. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/ruby_on_rails_quick_start.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: Ruby CODE: ``` MeiliSearch::Rails.configuration = { meilisearch_url: '', meilisearch_api_key: '' } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Create API Key Response Example DESCRIPTION: Example response when creating a new API key showing the generated key and its configured properties.
