SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/update_and_migration/updating.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -L https://install.meilisearch.com | sh ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Specific Index Filtering in JSON DESCRIPTION: Shows how to apply a specific filter rule to the 'patient_medical_records' index, limiting results to a particular user_id and published status. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/security/tenant_tokens.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "patient_medical_records": { "filter": "user_id = 1 AND published = true" } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initializing project and creating script file DESCRIPTION: Commands to create a new directory, initialize a Node.js project, and create a script file for the migration process. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/update_and_migration/algolia_migration.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` mkdir algolia-meilisearch-migration cd algolia-meilisearch-migration npm init -y touch script.js ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Task Webhook Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configuration for setting up webhook notifications for task completion events. Includes URL and optional authorization header settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/self_hosted/configure_meilisearch_at_launch.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` MEILI_TASK_WEBHOOK_URL="webhook_url" MEILI_TASK_WEBHOOK_AUTHORIZATION_HEADER="auth_token" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Meilisearch Version Information via API DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the JSON response structure when querying the /version endpoint of a Meilisearch instance. It includes the commit SHA, commit date, and package version of the running Meilisearch instance. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/version.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "commitSha": "b46889b5f0f2f8b91438a08a358ba8f05fc09fc1", "commitDate": "2019-11-15T09:51:54.278247+00:00", "pkgVersion": "0.1.1" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Reset Filterable Attributes Response DESCRIPTION: Response format when resetting filterable attributes showing the enqueued task details. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/settings.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "taskUid": 1, "indexUid": "movies", "status": "enqueued", "type": "settingsUpdate", "enqueuedAt": "2021-08-11T09:25:53.000000Z" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Geographic Radius Filter Structure DESCRIPTION: JSON structure for filtering results within a circular geographic area using latitude, longitude and distance in meters. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/search.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` _geoRadius(lat, lng, distance_in_meters) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Data Directories for Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: Creates the directories where Meilisearch will store its data, dumps, and snapshots, and sets appropriate permissions. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/running_production.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` mkdir /var/lib/meilisearch/data /var/lib/meilisearch/dumps /var/lib/meilisearch/snapshots chown -R meilisearch:meilisearch /var/lib/meilisearch chmod 750 /var/lib/meilisearch ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Restarting Meilisearch Service after Configuration Changes DESCRIPTION: Shows the command to restart the Meilisearch service after making configuration changes in a cloud-hosted instance. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/self_hosted/configure_meilisearch_at_launch.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` systemctl restart meilisearch ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configure OpenAI Source - JSON DESCRIPTION: Embedder configuration specifying OpenAI as the source for generating embeddings. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/ai_powered_search/getting_started_with_ai_search.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "products-openai": { "source": "openAi" } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Current Instance in Network Configuration DESCRIPTION: cURL command to specify which remote corresponds to the current instance using the self field. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/multi_search/implement_sharding.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl \ -X PATCH 'MEILISEARCH_URL/network' \ -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \ --data-binary '{ "self": "REMOTE_NAME_1" }' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Comparing Index Instantiation in Algolia and Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to instantiate an index in both Algolia and Meilisearch. In Algolia, the method is called on the client instance, while in Meilisearch, it's called on the client instance as well. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/update_and_migration/algolia_migration.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` client.initIndex() // Algolia client.index() // Meilisearch ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Downloading Meilisearch Default Configuration DESCRIPTION: Downloads the default configuration file for Meilisearch from the GitHub repository. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/running_production.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl https://raw.githubusercontent.com/meilisearch/meilisearch/latest/config.toml > /etc/meilisearch.toml ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Facet Search Response DESCRIPTION: Response from the facet search endpoint showing matching facet values and their document counts when searching for genre values starting with 'c'. This allows for searching within facet values. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/filtering_and_sorting/search_with_facet_filters.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { ‚Ä¶ "facetHits": [ { "value": "Children's Literature", "count": 1 }, { "value": "Classics", "count": 6 }, { "value": "Comedy", "count": 2 }, { "value": "Coming-of-Age", "count": 1 } ], "facetQuery": "c", ‚Ä¶ } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running older versions of Meilisearch using Docker DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to pull a specific version of Meilisearch Docker image and run it in development mode with a master key. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/self_hosted/install_meilisearch_locally.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Fetch specific version of Meilisearch image from DockerHub. Replace vX.Y.Z with the version you want to use docker pull getmeili/meilisearch:vX.Y.Z # Launch Meilisearch in development mode with a master key docker run -it --rm \ -p 7700:7700 \ -e MEILI_ENV='development' \ -v $(pwd)/meili_data:/meili_data \ getmeili/meilisearch:vX.Y.Z # Use ${pwd} instead of $(pwd) in PowerShell ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Meilisearch Rails Gem DESCRIPTION: Command to add the meilisearch-rails gem to the Rails application. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/ruby_on_rails_quick_start.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` bundle add meilisearch-rails ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Empty Array Response for Getting Separator Tokens in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: Shows the empty array response when getting separator tokens that haven't been explicitly set, indicating no custom separator tokens are configured. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/settings.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_42 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` [] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Task Status with Meilisearch API DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to use the Meilisearch API to retrieve information about a specific task using its taskUid. This allows you to monitor the progress and status of asynchronous operations. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/async/working_with_tasks.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "taskUid": 0, "indexUid": "movies", "status": "enqueued", "type": "documentAdditionOrUpdate", "enqueuedAt": "2021-08-11T09:25:53.000000Z" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Settings Update Task Response DESCRIPTION: JSON response structure returned when settings are updated, containing task ID and status information. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/settings.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "taskUid": 1, "indexUid": "movies", "status": "enqueued", "type": "settingsUpdate", "enqueuedAt": "2021-08-11T09:25:53.000000Z" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Highlighted Search Results Example in JSON DESCRIPTION: Example demonstrating how attributesToHighlight affects search results by wrapping matched terms in highlight tags within the overview field. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/search.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "id": 50393, "title": "Kung Fu Panda Holiday", "poster": "https://image.tmdb.org/t/p/w1280/gp18R42TbSUlw9VnXFqyecm52lq.jpg", "overview": "The Winter Feast is Po's favorite holiday. Every year he and his father hang decorations, cook together, and serve noodle soup to the villagers. But this year Shifu informs Po that as Dragon Warrior, it is his duty to host the formal Winter Feast at the Jade Palace. Po is caught between his obligations as the Dragon Warrior and his family traditions: between Shifu and Mr. Ping.", "release_date": 1290729600, "_formatted": { "id": 50393, "title": "Kung Fu Panda Holiday", "poster": "https://image.tmdb.org/t/p/w1280/gp18R42TbSUlw9VnXFqyecm52lq.jpg", "overview": "The Winter Feast is Po's favorite holiday. Every year he and his father hang decorations, cook together, and serve noodle soup to the villagers. But this year Shifu informs Po that as Dragon Warrior, it is his duty to host the formal Winter Feast at the Jade Palace. Po is caught between his obligations as the Dragon Warrior and his family traditions: between Shifu and Mr. Ping.", "release_date": 1290729600 } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling and Restarting Nginx Service DESCRIPTION: Reloads systemd configuration, enables Nginx to start on system boot, and restarts the Nginx service to apply the new configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/running_production.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` systemctl daemon-reload systemctl enable nginx systemctl restart nginx ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Compiling older versions of Meilisearch from source DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to clone the Meilisearch repository, checkout a specific version, compile the project, and execute the binary. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/self_hosted/install_meilisearch_locally.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` git clone https://github.com/meilisearch/meilisearch cd meilisearch # Replace vX.Y.Z with the specific version you want to use git checkout vX.Y.Z # Update the Rust toolchain to the latest version rustup update # Compile the project cargo build --release # Execute the binary ./target/release/meilisearch ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Task List Response in JSON DESCRIPTION: Example JSON response for the GET /tasks endpoint, which retrieves a list of tasks. The response includes an array of task objects, pagination information, and metadata about the result set. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/tasks.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "results": [ { "uid": 1, "indexUid": "movies_reviews", "status": "failed", "type": "documentAdditionOrUpdate", "canceledBy": null, "details": { "receivedDocuments": 100, "indexedDocuments": 0 }, "error": null, "duration": null, "enqueuedAt": "2021-08-12T10:00:00.000000Z", "startedAt": null, "finishedAt": null }, { "uid": 0, "indexUid": "movies", "status": "succeeded", "type": "documentAdditionOrUpdate", "canceledBy": null, "details": { "receivedDocuments": 100, "indexedDocuments": 100 }, "error": null, "duration": "PT16S", "enqueuedAt": "2021-08-11T09:25:53.000000Z", "startedAt": "2021-08-11T10:03:00.000000Z", "finishedAt": "2021-08-11T10:03:16.000000Z" } ], "total": 50, "limit": 20, "from": 1, "next": null } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Sending API Request to Meilisearch Cloud Edge URL DESCRIPTION: Example of using curl to send a search request to the Meilisearch Cloud Edge URL. This URL must be used after enabling analytics to ensure search metrics are tracked properly. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/analytics/configure_analytics.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` curl \ -X POST 'https://edge.meilisearch.com/indexes/products/search' \ -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \ --data-binary '{ "q": "green socks" }' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing Meilisearch Dump (Local Installation) DESCRIPTION: Command to launch Meilisearch and import a dump file on a local installation. This is the final step in restoring the database after migration. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/update_and_migration/updating.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ./meilisearch --import-dump dumps/{dump_uid.dump} --master-key="MASTER_KEY" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Nested Field Filter Expression DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to filter using dot notation for nested fields in the document structure. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/filtering_and_sorting/filter_search_results.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` filter="genres = 'Thriller' AND rating.users > 85" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing a Dump in Meilisearch with Docker DESCRIPTION: Command to run Meilisearch and import a dump file during startup. The dump file must be accessible from within the container through a mounted volume. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/docker.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` docker run -it --rm \ -p 7700:7700 \ -v $(pwd)/meili_data:/meili_data \ getmeili/meilisearch:v1.14 \ meilisearch --import-dump /meili_data/dumps/20200813-042312213.dump ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Page Number Tracking for Pagination UI in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows how to keep track of the current page number in a pagination interface. It updates an HTML element with the current page number when users click 'Previous' or 'Next' buttons. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/front_end/pagination.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` function updatePageNumber(elem) { const directionBtn = elem.id // Get the page number stored in the pagination element let pageNumber = parseInt(document.querySelector('.pagination').dataset.pageNumber) // Update page number if (directionBtn === 'previous_button') { pageNumber = pageNumber - 1 } else if (directionBtn === 'next_button') { pageNumber = pageNumber + 1 } // Store new page number in the pagination element document.querySelector('.pagination').dataset.pageNumber = pageNumber } // Add data to our HTML element stating the user is on the first page document.querySelector('.pagination').dataset.pageNumber = 0 // Each time a user clicks on the previous or next buttons, update the page number document.querySelector('#previous_button').onclick = function () { updatePageNumber(this) } document.querySelector('#next_button').onclick = function () { updatePageNumber(this) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Response Structure for Facet Search Update Task - JSON DESCRIPTION: Example response after updating facet search settings, showing the task information that can be used to track the status of the update operation. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/settings.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_24 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "taskUid": 1, "indexUid": "INDEX_UID", "status": "enqueued", "type": "settingsUpdate", "enqueuedAt": "2024-07-19T22:33:18.523881Z" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Update Index Response DESCRIPTION: Task response returned when updating an existing index. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/indexes.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "taskUid": 1, "indexUid": "movies", "status": "enqueued", "type": "indexUpdate", "enqueuedAt": "2021-08-12T10:00:00.000000Z" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Update Filterable Attributes Response DESCRIPTION: Response format when updating filterable attributes showing the enqueued task details including task ID, index, status and timestamp. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/settings.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "taskUid": 1, "indexUid": "movies", "status": "enqueued", "type": "settingsUpdate", "enqueuedAt": "2021-08-11T09:25:53.000000Z" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running the Vue Application DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Vue development server. This launches the application for local development and testing of the Meilisearch integration. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/front_end/vue_quick_start.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm run dev ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Vue3 Application DESCRIPTION: Command to create a new Vue application using npm. This initializes a Vue project with the latest version and sets up the basic folder structure. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/front_end/vue_quick_start.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm create vue@latest my-app ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Create Index Request Body DESCRIPTION: Required payload structure for creating a new index, specifying the UID and optional primary key. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/indexes.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "uid": "movies", "primaryKey": "id" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Sending Search Query to Meilisearch API DESCRIPTION: Example of how to make a search request to the Meilisearch API using curl. After disabling analytics, you need to update your application to use the correct project URL for all API requests. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/analytics/deactivate_analytics_monitoring.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` curl \ -X POST 'https://PROJECT_URL/indexes/products/search' \ -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \ --data-binary '{ "q": "green socks" }' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Removing Default Nginx Configuration DESCRIPTION: Deletes the default Nginx configuration file to avoid conflicts with the custom Meilisearch configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/running_production.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rm -f /etc/nginx/sites-enabled/default ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Reformatted JSON for Meilisearch Querying DESCRIPTION: Example of reformatted JSON data to work around Meilisearch's nested querying limitations by merging appointment data into a single field. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/engine/datatypes.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` [ { "id": 0, "patient_name": "Imogen Temult", "appointmentsMerged": [ "2022-01-01 Jester Lavorre" ] }, { "id": 1, "patient_name": "Caleb Widowgast", "appointmentsMerged": [ "2023-01-01 Jester Lavorre" "2022-01-01 Dorian Storm" ] } ] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Equality Operator Filter in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: A filter using the equality operator to return documents with a specific value for the 'genres' attribute. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/filtering_and_sorting/filter_expression_reference.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` genres = action ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Getting Typo Tolerance Settings Response DESCRIPTION: JSON response showing the current typo tolerance configuration for a Meilisearch index including minimum word sizes and disabled options. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/settings.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_51 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "enabled": true, "minWordSizeForTypos": { "oneTypo": 5, "twoTypos": 9 }, "disableOnWords": [], "disableOnAttributes": [] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Request: Delete Documents by Batch DESCRIPTION: Example request body for deleting multiple documents by their IDs. Provides an array of document IDs to be deleted. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/documents.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` [23488, 153738, 437035, 363869] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Response: Delete Documents by Batch DESCRIPTION: Example response when deleting documents by batch. Returns a task object with details about the deletion operation. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/documents.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "taskUid": 1, "indexUid": "movies", "status": "enqueued", "type": "documentDeletion", "enqueuedAt": "2021-08-11T09:25:53.000000Z" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Get Localized Attributes Response DESCRIPTION: Example response showing the localized attributes settings with Japanese locale configuration for attributes matching pattern '*_ja'. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/settings.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "localizedAttributes": [ {"locales": ["jpn"], "attributePatterns": ["*_ja"]} ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Update Meilisearch Index Settings - Shell DESCRIPTION: cURL command to update Meilisearch index settings with the configured embedder. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/ai_powered_search/getting_started_with_ai_search.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` curl \ -X PATCH 'MEILISEARCH_URL/indexes/kitchenware/settings/embedders' \ -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \ --data-binary '{ "products-openai": { "source": "openAi", "apiKey": "OPEN_AI_API_KEY", "model": "text-embedding-3-small", "documentTemplate": "An object used in a kitchen named \'{{doc.name}}\'"\n } }' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Example of Localized Search Results in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: Sample search response when using the locales parameter, showing how Meilisearch returns documents with localized content based on the specified language preferences. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/search.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "hits": [ { "id": 0, "title": "DOCUMENT NAME", "overview_jp": "OVERVIEW TEXT IN JAPANESE" } ‚Ä¶ ], ‚Ä¶ } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Nginx for Reverse Proxy DESCRIPTION: Installs Nginx which will serve as a reverse proxy for Meilisearch, handling external HTTP requests. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/running_production.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` apt-get install nginx -y ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Conversion Event Object in JSON for Meilisearch Analytics DESCRIPTION: The structure of a conversion event object to be sent to the /events endpoint. This object tracks user conversions and includes event type, name, index UID, object ID, and position in search results. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/analytics/events_endpoint.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "eventType": "conversion", "eventName": "Product Added To Cart", "indexUid": "products", "objectID": "0", "position": 0 } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: IN Operator Filter in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: Two equivalent filters using the IN operator to return documents where 'genres' includes either 'horror', 'comedy', or both. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/filtering_and_sorting/filter_expression_reference.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` genres IN [horror, comedy] genres = horror OR genres = comedy ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Negated IS NULL Operator Filters in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: Two equivalent ways to write a negated IS NULL filter that returns documents where the 'overview' field is not null. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/filtering_and_sorting/filter_expression_reference.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` overview IS NOT NULL NOT overview IS NULL ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking Dump Status in Meilisearch v0.27 and Below DESCRIPTION: API call to check the status of a dump creation in Meilisearch versions 0.27 and below. This is used to ensure the dump is complete before proceeding with the migration. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/update_and_migration/updating.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl \ -X GET 'http:///dumps/:dump_uid/status' \ -H 'Authorization: Bearer API_KEY' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Meilisearch Dump Creation Response DESCRIPTION: Example JSON response from the Meilisearch server after initiating a dump creation. This response includes a taskUid which can be used to track the status of the dump creation process. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/update_and_migration/updating.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "taskUid": 1, "indexUid": null, "status": "enqueued", "type": "dumpCreation", "enqueuedAt": "2022-06-21T16:10:29.217688Z" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling Typo Tolerance for Specific Words DESCRIPTION: Specifies a list of words for which typo tolerance should be disabled. This setting is case insensitive and prevents Meilisearch from applying typo tolerance to these specific terms. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/relevancy/typo_tolerance_settings.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` {"disableOnWords": ["Shrek"]} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Response Structure for Proximity Precision Reset Task - JSON DESCRIPTION: Example response after resetting proximity precision settings to the default value, returning task information for tracking the reset operation. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/settings.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_22 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "taskUid": 1, "indexUid": "books", "status": "enqueued", "type": "settingsUpdate", "enqueuedAt": "2023-04-14T15:51:47.821044Z" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Voyage AI Embedder Settings in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration for setting up the Voyage AI embedder in Meilisearch. It specifies the API endpoint, authentication, model parameters, and response structure needed to generate and process embeddings. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/embedders/voyage.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "voyage": { "source": "rest", "apiKey": "", "dimensions": 1024, "documentTemplate": "", "url": "https://api.voyageai.com/v1/embeddings", "request": { "model": "voyage-2", "input": ["{{text}}", "{{..}}"] }, "response": { "data": [ { "embedding": "{{embedding}}" }, "{{..}}" ] } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a New Rails Application DESCRIPTION: Command to create a new Ruby on Rails application named 'blog'. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/improve_relevancy_large_documents.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` [ { "id": 0, "title": "A Haunted House", "author": "Virginia Woolf", "text": "Whatever hour you woke there was a door shutting. From room to room they went, hand in hand, lifting here, opening there, making sure‚Äîa ghostly couple.\n\n \"Here we left it,\" she said. And he added, \"Oh, but here too!\" \"It's upstairs,\" she murmured. \"And in the garden,\" he whispered. \"Quietly,\" they said, \"or we shall wake them.\"\n\nBut it wasn't that you woke us. Oh, no. \"They're looking for it; they're drawing the curtain,\" one might say, and so read on a page or two. \"Now they've found it,\" one would be certain, stopping the pencil on the margin. And then, tired of reading, one might rise and see for oneself, the house all empty, the doors standing open, only the wood pigeons bubbling with content and the hum of the threshing machine sounding from the farm. \"What did I come in here for? What did I want to find?\" My hands were empty. \"Perhaps it's upstairs then?\" The apples were in the loft. And so down again, the garden still as ever, only the book had slipped into the grass.\n\nBut they had found it in the drawing room. Not that one could ever see them. The window panes reflected apples, reflected roses; all the leaves were green in the glass. If they moved in the drawing room, the apple only turned its yellow side. Yet, the moment after, if the door was opened, spread about the floor, hung upon the walls, pendant from the ceiling‚Äîwhat? My hands were empty. The shadow of a thrush crossed the carpet; from the deepest wells of silence the wood pigeon drew its bubble of sound. \"Safe, safe, safe,\" the pulse of the house beat softly. \"The treasure buried; the room ...\" the pulse stopped short. Oh, was that the buried treasure?\n\nA moment later the light had faded. Out in the garden then? But the trees spun darkness for a wandering beam of sun. So fine, so rare, coolly sunk beneath the surface the beam I sought always burnt behind the glass. Death was the glass; death was between us; coming to the woman first, hundreds of years ago, leaving the house, sealing all the windows; the rooms were darkened. He left it, left her, went North, went East, saw the stars turned in the Southern sky; sought the house, found it dropped beneath the Downs. \"Safe, safe, safe,\" the pulse of the house beat gladly. \"The Treasure yours.\"\n\nThe wind roars up the avenue. Trees stoop and bend this way and that. Moonbeams splash and spill wildly in the rain. But the beam of the lamp falls straight from the window. The candle burns stiff and still. Wandering through the house, opening the windows, whispering not to wake us, the ghostly couple seek their joy.\n\n\"Here we slept,\" she says. And he adds, \"Kisses without number.\" \"Waking in the morning‚Äî\" \"Silver between the trees‚Äî\" \"Upstairs‚Äî\" \"In the garden‚Äî\" \"When summer came‚Äî\" \"In winter snowtime‚Äî\" The doors go shutting far in the distance, gently knocking like the pulse of a heart.\n\nNearer they come; cease at the doorway. The wind falls, the rain slides silver down the glass. Our eyes darken; we hear no steps beside us; we see no lady spread her ghostly cloak. His hands shield the lantern. \"Look,\" he breathes. \"Sound asleep. Love upon their lips.\"\n\nStooping, holding their silver lamp above us, long they look and deeply. Long they pause. The wind drives straightly; the flame stoops slightly. Wild beams of moonlight cross both floor and wall, and, meeting, stain the faces bent; the faces pondering; the faces that search the sleepers and seek their hidden joy.\n\n\"Safe, safe, safe,\" the heart of the house beats proudly. \"Long years‚Äî\" he sighs. \"Again you found me.\" \"Here,\" she murmurs, \"sleeping; in the garden reading; laughing, rolling apples in the loft. Here we left our treasure‚Äî\" Stooping, their light lifts the lids upon my eyes. \"Safe! safe! safe!\" the pulse of the house beats wildly. Waking, I cry \"Oh, is this _your_ buried treasure? No, thank you‚ÄîThe commonwealth of the future)‚Äîthe firelight darting and making the room red, save for the black figures and their bright eyes, while outside a van discharges, Miss Thingummy drinks tea at her desk, and plate-glass preserves fur coats‚Äî‚Äî\n\nFlaunted, leaf-light, drifting at corners, blown across the wheels, silver-splashed, home or not home, gathered, scattered, squandered in separate scales, swept up, down, torn, sunk, assembled‚Äîand truth?\n\nNow to recollect by the fireside on the white square of marble. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/data_backup/snapshots.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` meilisearch --schedule-snapshot=3600 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Assembling Complete Meilisearch Tenant Token Payload in JSON DESCRIPTION: Combines expiration timestamp, API key UID, and search rules into a single JSON object for the token payload. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/security/generate_tenant_token_scratch.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "exp": UNIX_TIMESTAMP, "apiKeyUid": "API_KEY_UID", "searchRules": { "INDEX_NAME": { "filter": "ATTRIBUTE = VALUE" } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Body Format for Searchable Attributes in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: Shows the expected format for setting searchable attributes in Meilisearch. The array of strings should be provided in order of importance, from most to least important attribute. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/settings.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_36 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` [, , ‚Ä¶] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting Meilisearch from an Existing Snapshot DESCRIPTION: This command launches Meilisearch and imports data from an existing snapshot file. This approach is faster than adding documents manually or starting from a dump, as snapshots are exact copies of the database. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/data_backup/snapshots.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` meilisearch --import-snapshot mySnapShots/data.ms.snapshot ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Getting Displayed Attributes DESCRIPTION: API request to retrieve the current displayed attributes configuration using legacy authentication. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/update_and_migration/updating.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl \ -H "X-Meili-API-Key: API_KEY" \ -X GET 'http:///indexes/{indexUid}/settings/displayed-attributes' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Verifying DNS Configuration for Meilisearch Instance DESCRIPTION: Use curl to check if the domain name is properly linked to the Meilisearch instance. This command sends a request to the /health endpoint and expects a 200 OK response with a specific body. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/deployment/digitalocean.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -v http:///health ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Meilisearch Setup Script DESCRIPTION: Command to run the Meilisearch configuration script for setting up instance parameters. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/deployment/aws.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` meilisearch-setup ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Response Structure for Pagination Reset Task - JSON DESCRIPTION: Example response after resetting pagination settings to their default values, returning task information for tracking the reset operation. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/settings.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "taskUid": 1, "indexUid": "books", "status": "enqueued", "type": "settingsUpdate", "enqueuedAt": "2022-04-14T20:53:32.863107Z" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Compiling Meilisearch with CUDA Support DESCRIPTION: Cargo command to compile Meilisearch with CUDA features enabled. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/computing_hugging_face_embeddings_gpu.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` cargo build --release --features cuda ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Scheduling Snapshots in Meilisearch Using Command Line DESCRIPTION: This command launches Meilisearch with automatic snapshot creation enabled. By default, Meilisearch creates the first snapshot on launch and then creates a new one every 24 hours, overwriting the previous one. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/data_backup/snapshots.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` meilisearch --schedule-snapshot ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: EXISTS Operator Filter in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: A filter that checks for the existence of a field, returning all documents containing the 'release_date' field. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/filtering_and_sorting/filter_expression_reference.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` release_date EXISTS ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Typo Tolerance Settings Response DESCRIPTION: JSON response showing the task details after updating typo tolerance settings for a Meilisearch index. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/settings.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_52 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "taskUid": 1, "indexUid": "books", "status": "enqueued", "type": "settingsUpdate", "enqueuedAt": "2022-04-14T20:56:44.991039Z" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displayed Attributes Response DESCRIPTION: Example response showing configured displayed attributes for search results. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/settings.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` [ "title", "overview", "genres", "release_date.year" ] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Sending a Search Request to Meilisearch Cloud Monitoring URL DESCRIPTION: Example of how to make a search request using the monitoring-enabled edge URL after activating Meilisearch Cloud monitoring. The request searches for "green socks" in the products index. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/analytics/configure_monitoring.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` curl \ -X POST 'http://edge.meilisearch.com/indexes/products/search' \ -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \ --data-binary '{ "q": "green socks" }' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Meilisearch Setup Script DESCRIPTION: Command to run the Meilisearch setup script, which guides the user through configuring settings for production use. This script can be run at any time to modify the configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/deployment/digitalocean.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` meilisearch-setup ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Meilisearch Binary DESCRIPTION: Command to run the compiled Meilisearch binary. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/computing_hugging_face_embeddings_gpu.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` ./meilisearch ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Meilisearch with Docker DESCRIPTION: Basic command to run Meilisearch in a Docker container. It maps port 7700, mounts a volume for data persistence, and uses a specific Meilisearch version. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/docker.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` docker run -it --rm \ -p 7700:7700 \ -v $(pwd)/meili_data:/meili_data \ getmeili/meilisearch:v1.14 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Example Document Structure with UNIX Timestamps in JSON DESCRIPTION: Sample JSON dataset of video games with release dates formatted as UNIX timestamps. Each document includes an id, title, genre, and release_timestamp field. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/filtering_and_sorting/working_with_dates.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` [ { "id": 0, "title": "Return of the Obra Dinn", "genre": "adventure", "release_timestamp": 1538949600 }, { "id": 1, "title": "The Excavation of Hob's Barrow", "genre": "adventure", "release_timestamp": 1664316000 }, { "id": 2, "title": "Bayonetta 2", "genre": "action", "release_timestamp": 1411164000 } ] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Optional Parameters to REST Embedder Request DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to add optional configuration parameters to the embedder request, such as encoding_format for the Mistral provider. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/ai_powered_search/configure_rest_embedder.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "EMBEDDER_NAME": { "source": "rest", "url": "PROVIDER_URL", "request": { "model": "MODEL_NAME", "input": ["{{text}}", "{{..}}"], "encoding_format": "float" } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Import Dump Option in Meilisearch Configuration File DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to set the import_dump option in a Meilisearch TOML configuration file. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/self_hosted/configure_meilisearch_at_launch.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: toml CODE: ``` import_dump = "./example.dump" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Task Status Response DESCRIPTION: Example of a successful document addition task response showing status and processing details SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/self_hosted/getting_started_with_self_hosted_meilisearch.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "uid": 0, "indexUid": "movies", "status": "succeeded", "type": "documentAdditionOrUpdate", "canceledBy": null, "details": { "receivedDocuments": 19547, "indexedDocuments": 19547 }, "error": null, "duration": "PT0.030750S", "enqueuedAt": "2021-12-20T12:39:18.349288Z", "startedAt": "2021-12-20T12:39:18.352490Z", "finishedAt": "2021-12-20T12:39:18.380038Z" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Sample Movie Database Structure in JSON DESCRIPTION: Example of the movie_ratings collection structure showing nested fields and data types used for filtering. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/filtering_and_sorting/filter_search_results.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` [ { "id": 458723, "title": "Us", "director": "Jordan Peele", "release_date": 1552521600, "genres": [ "Thriller", "Horror", "Mystery" ], "rating": { "critics": 86, "users": 73 } } ] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Response for Updating Search Cutoff in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: Shows the response from the API when updating the search cutoff value. Returns a task ID that can be used to track the status of the update operation. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/settings.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_40 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "taskUid": 1, "indexUid": "movies", "status": "enqueued", "type": "settingsUpdate", "enqueuedAt": "2023-03-21T06:33:41.000000Z" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking Meilisearch Instance Health with cURL DESCRIPTION: A bash command to verify that a Meilisearch instance is running properly by checking its health endpoint. The server should respond with a 200 OK status code if everything is working correctly. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/deployment/aws.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -v http:///health ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Claude Desktop MCP Settings DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration for adding the Meilisearch MCP server to Claude Desktop's configuration file (claude_desktop_config.json). SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/security/generate_tenant_token_third_party.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl \ -X GET 'MEILISEARCH_URL/keys/API_KEY' \ -H 'Authorization: Bearer MASTER_KEY' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Delete Index Response DESCRIPTION: Task response returned when deleting an index. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/settings.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_50 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "taskUid": 1, "indexUid": "movies", "status": "enqueued", "type": "settingsUpdate", "enqueuedAt": "2021-08-11T09:25:53.000000Z" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Repository Clone Command DESCRIPTION: Git command to clone the Meilisearch.com repository SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/running-locally.md#2025-04-16_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` git clone git@github.com:meilisearch/meilisearch.com.git ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Moving Meilisearch Binary to System Path DESCRIPTION: Moves the Meilisearch binary file to /usr/local/bin to make it accessible from anywhere in the system. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/analytics/events_endpoint.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "eventType": "click", "eventName": "Search Result Clicked", "indexUid": "products", "objectId": "0", "position": 0 } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Testing Certbot Auto-Renewal DESCRIPTION: Performs a dry run of the certificate renewal process to verify that automatic renewal is correctly configured. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/running_production.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo certbot renew --dry-run ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling Telemetry Data Collection in Meilisearch via Command-line Option DESCRIPTION: This command demonstrates how to disable data collection in Meilisearch using a command-line option. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/resources/telemetry.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` meilisearch --no-analytics ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: STARTS WITH Operator Filter in Meilisearch (Experimental) DESCRIPTION: An experimental filter using the STARTS WITH operator to return dairy products whose names start with the string 'kef'. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/filtering_and_sorting/filter_expression_reference.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` dairy_products.name STARTS WITH kef ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling Telemetry Data Collection in Meilisearch via Environment Variable DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to disable data collection in Meilisearch by setting an environment variable. It requires setting the variable and then restarting the Meilisearch instance. This helps Windows users identify where their Meilisearch installation is located. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/update_and_migration/updating.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` where meilisearch ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Activating Experimental CONTAINS Filter in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: A curl command that enables the experimental CONTAINS filter feature by updating experimental features configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/filtering_and_sorting/filter_expression_reference.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_26 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` [["genres = horror", "genres = comedy"], "director = 'Jordan Peele'"] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling Telemetry Data Collection in Meilisearch on Cloud Services DESCRIPTION: This code snippet provides instructions for disabling data collection in Meilisearch when running on cloud services. It involves editing the Meilisearch service file, adding the no-analytics flag, and restarting the service. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/resources/telemetry.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # The following procedure should work for all cloud providers, # including DigitalOcean, Google Cloud Platform, and Amazon Web Services. # First, open /etc/systemd/system/meilisearch.service with a text editor: nano /etc/systemd/system/meilisearch.service # Then add --no-analytics at the end of the command in ExecStart # Don't forget to save and quit! # Finally, run the following two commands: systemctl daemon-reload systemctl restart meilisearch ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Meilisearch by direct download DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to rename the downloaded Meilisearch binary, give it execute permissions, and launch the server. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/self_hosted/install_meilisearch_locally.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Rename binary to meilisearch. Replace {meilisearch_os} with the name of the downloaded binary mv {meilisearch_os} meilisearch # Give the binary execute permission chmod +x meilisearch # Launch Meilisearch ./meilisearch ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Meilisearch Database Dump DESCRIPTION: API call to create a dump of the Meilisearch database. This is a crucial step in the migration process, allowing users to backup their data before updating. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/update_and_migration/updating.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl \ -X POST 'http://localhost:7700/dumps' \ -H 'Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Complex Nested Filters with Parentheses in SQL DESCRIPTION: Shows various levels of filter nesting using parentheses for clarity, demonstrating different nesting depths. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/resources/known_limitations.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: sql CODE: ``` user = 1 OR (user = 2 AND user = 3) # Depth 4 user = 1 OR (user = 2 AND (user = 3 OR (user = 4 AND user = 5))) # Though this filter is longer, its nesting depth is still 2 user = 1 OR (user = 2 AND user = 3) OR (user = 4 AND user = 5) OR user = 6 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Requesting Compressed Response from Meilisearch API DESCRIPTION: Shows how to request a compressed response from Meilisearch API using the Accept-Encoding header with gzip algorithm. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/overview.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -sH 'Accept-encoding: gzip' 'MEILISEARCH_URL/indexes/movies/search' | gzip - ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Connecting to Meilisearch via SSH with IPv4 DESCRIPTION: SSH connection command using the admin username and public IPv4 address with a key pair file for authentication. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/deployment/aws.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ssh -i admin@ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Search Rules for Tenant Token in JSON DESCRIPTION: JSON structure defining search rules for a tenant token, specifying filters for specific indexes to control data access. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/security/generate_tenant_token_sdk.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "patient_medical_records": { "filter": "user_id = 1" } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Old Authorization Header Example for Meilisearch v0.24 and Below DESCRIPTION: Shows the deprecated X-MEILI-API-KEY header used for authorization in Meilisearch versions 0.24 and earlier. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/overview.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Hugging Face Embedder DESCRIPTION: cURL command to configure the Hugging Face embedder in Meilisearch index settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/computing_hugging_face_embeddings_gpu.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` curl \ -X PATCH 'MEILISEARCH_URL/indexes/INDEX_NAME/settings/embedders' \ -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \ --data-binary '{ "default": { "source": "huggingFace" } }' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Meilisearch MCP Server DESCRIPTION: Commands for installing the Meilisearch MCP server using either uv or pip package managers. Requires Python 3.9 or higher. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/ai/mcp.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Using uv (recommended) uv pip install meilisearch-mcp # Using pip pip install meilisearch-mcp ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Establishing SSH Connection to DigitalOcean Droplet DESCRIPTION: Command to initiate an SSH connection to the DigitalOcean Droplet using the IP address provided by DigitalOcean. This is required to access the Droplet and run the configuration script. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/deployment/digitalocean.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ssh root@DIGITAL_OCEAN_IP_ADDRESS ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Dependencies with Yarn DESCRIPTION: Command to install required dependencies for running documentation versions v0.17-v1.1 locally. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/update_and_migration/previous_docs_version.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` yarn install ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Meilisearch Query for Nested Data DESCRIPTION: cURL command demonstrating a Meilisearch query attempting to filter on nested appointment data, which returns unexpected results due to the flattened structure. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/engine/datatypes.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` curl \ -X POST 'MEILISEARCH_URL/indexes/clinic_patients/search' \ -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \ --data-binary '{ "q": "", "filter": "(appointments.date = 2022-01-01 AND appointments.doctor = \'Jester Lavorre\')"\n }' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Vercel CLI Command DESCRIPTION: Command to globally install the Vercel CLI using Yarn package manager SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/running-locally.md#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` yarn global add vercel ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking Meilisearch Service Status DESCRIPTION: Verifies that the Meilisearch service is running correctly by checking its status. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/running_production.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` systemctl status meilisearch ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Vercel Environment Setup Commands DESCRIPTION: Commands to link Vercel project and pull environment configuration SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/running-locally.md#2025-04-16_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` vercel link ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` vercel env pull ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Ownership of Meilisearch Binary DESCRIPTION: Assigns ownership of the Meilisearch binary to the newly created meilisearch user and group. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/running_production.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` chown meilisearch:meilisearch /usr/local/bin/meilisearch ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking glibc Version on Linux DESCRIPTION: Command to verify the installed version of glibc on Linux systems. Required for determining Meilisearch compatibility, which needs glibc 2.35 or later. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/self_hosted/supported_os.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ldd --version ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Get Network Configuration Response in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: This JSON response shows the structure of the data returned when getting the current network configuration using the GET /network endpoint. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/reference/api/network.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "self": "ms-00", "remotes": { "ms-00": { "url": "http://ms-1235.example.meilisearch.io", "searchApiKey": "Ecd1SDDi4pqdJD6qYLxD3y7VZAEb4d9j6LJgt4d6xas" }, "ms-01": { "url": "http://ms-4242.example.meilisearch.io", "searchApiKey": "hrVu-OMcjPGElK7692K7bwriBoGyHXTMvB5NmZkMKqQ" } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Basic Organization Model with Contacts Relationship in PHP DESCRIPTION: This code defines a basic Organization model with a hasMany relationship to Contact models, establishing the foundation for multitenancy. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/guides/laravel_multitenancy.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: php CODE: ``` hasMany(Contact::class); } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Incorrectly Parsed Filter without Parentheses in Meilisearch DESCRIPTION: The same filter without parentheses, showing how it would be incorrectly parsed due to operator precedence. SOURCE: https://github.com/meilisearch/documentation/blob/main/learn/filtering_and_sorting/filter_expression_reference.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_23 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` genres = horror OR (genres = comedy AND release_date > 795484800) ```
